text: Kamyar Cyrus Habib (born August 22, 1981) is an American politician, lawyer, and educator. He was the 16th Lieutenant Governor of Washington. He has been fully blind since he lost his eyesight to cancer at age eight. He is both the first and only Iranian-American official to hold statewide elected office in the United States. In March 2020, he announced plans to quit politics and become a Jesuit priest. ==References== Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:Lieutenant Governors of Washington (state) Category:Lawyers from Baltimore Category:Lawyers from Washington (state) Category:Educators from Washington (state) Category:Politicians from Baltimore Category:Businesspeople from Baltimore Category:Businesspeople from Washington (state) Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Educators from Baltimore
title: Cyrus Habib
